floodArea.riverOrSea: River Brathay, River Rothay, River Winster

items.message:
Fluctuating river levels throughout the day (Saturday 28/06/2025) may lead to flooding.
Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible but property flooding is not expected.
Areas most at risk include the Rivers Brathay and Rothay, and low lying areas around Grasmere and Ambleside.
Further rainfall is forecast today potentially bringing heavy downpours to the area. We are closely monitoring the situation.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.
This message will be updated by 5:00 PM on 28/06/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message:
High river levels this morning may lead to flooding.
No property flooding is expected.
Flooding is possible throughout Saturday 28/06/2025.
Areas most at risk include The Upper Derwent from Seathwaite to Derwent Water.
Weather conditions are expected to improve this evening and we are monitoring rainfall and river levels.
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 5:00 PM on 28/06/2025, or as the situation changes.
